description: This file defines a Timer class used for measuring code execution time, utilizing Python's perf_counter for high-resolution timing.

classes.name: Timer
classes.description: A class for timing code execution, providing start, stop, and context management methods, as well as a method to output timing data as a dictionary.

methods.name: __init__
methods.description: Initializes the Timer object with optional start, end, and elapsed time attributes.

methods.name: elapsed
methods.description: Property that returns the elapsed time; computes it if not already set.

methods.name: start
methods.description: Starts the timer by recording the current perf_counter value.

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the timer and calculates the elapsed time.

methods.name: __enter__
methods.description: Enables use of the Timer as a context manager, starting the timer.

methods.name: __exit__
methods.description: Stops the timer when exiting the context manager.

methods.name: to_dict
methods.description: Returns a dictionary representation of the timing data, with times as strings.
